intro: Lobelia draba, commonly known as the alpine lobelia, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Lobelia draba has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is often found in meadows and on slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
